hints.label: thm-hamiltonian-ground-state
hints.title: Hamiltonian Ground State Uniqueness
hints.content:
2066: :label: thm-hamiltonian-ground-state
2067: 
2068: The Hamiltonian $H$ from Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lindbladian-corrected`:
2069: 
2070: $$
2071: H = \int dx \, dv \, \psi^\dagger(x, v) \left[-\frac{\hbar^2}{2m}\nabla_x^2 + U(x) + \frac{1}{2}m v^2\right] \psi(x, v)
2072: $$
2073: 
2074: has a **unique ground state** $|0\rangle$ (vacuum) with energy $E_0 = 0$ (after normal ordering).
2075: 
2076: **Proof**: The Hamiltonian is the sum of:
2077: 1. Kinetic energy: $\geq 0$ (positive operator)
2078: 2. Potential energy: $U(x) \geq -C$ (coercive from {doc}`04_convergence.md`)
2079: 3. Velocity energy: $\geq 0$ (positive operator)

hints.label: thm-hamiltonian-mass-gap
hints.title: Hamiltonian Mass Gap from QSD Spectral Gap
hints.content:
2085: :label: thm-hamiltonian-mass-gap
2086: 
2087: The Hamiltonian $H$ has a **mass gap**:
2088: 
2089: $$
2090: \Delta_H := \inf(\text{Spec}(H|_{\mathcal{H}_1}) - E_0) > 0
2091: $$
2092: 
2093: where $\mathcal{H}_1$ is the one-particle sector.
2094: 
2095: **Relation to classical spectral gap**: The mass gap is related to the spectral gap $\lambda_{\text{gap}}$ of the classical generator via:
2096: 
2097: $$
2098: \Delta_H = \lambda_{\text{gap}} \hbar_{\text{eff}}
2099: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-44
hints.content:
2103: 
2104: :::{prf:proof}
2105: **Step 1: Single-particle Hamiltonian.**
2106: 
2107: In the one-particle sector $\mathcal{H}_1 = L^2(\mathcal{X} \times \mathcal{V})$, the Hamiltonian reduces to:
2108: 
2109: $$
2110: H_1 = -\frac{\hbar^2}{2m}\nabla_x^2 + U(x) + \frac{1}{2}m v^2 - \gamma v \cdot \nabla_v + \gamma D_{\text{reg}} \nabla_v^2
2111: $$
2112: 
2113: This is exactly the generator of the **underdamped Langevin dynamics** from {doc}`04_convergence.md`.
2114: 
2115: **Step 2: Spectral gap of Langevin generator.**
2116: 
2117: From {doc}`08_emergent_geometry.md`, Theorem 2.1, the generator has spectral gap:
2118: 
2119: $$
2120: \lambda_{\text{gap}} \geq \kappa_{\text{total}} = O(\min\{\gamma, c_{\min}(\rho), \kappa_{\text{conf}}\}) > 0
2121: $$
2122: 
2123: **Step 3: Dimensional restoration.**
2124: 
2125: The classical generator has dimension $[T]^{-1}$ (inverse time). To get energy, we multiply by $\hbar_{\text{eff}}$:
2126: 
2127: $$
2128: \Delta_H = \lambda_{\text{gap}} \cdot \hbar_{\text{eff}}
2129: $$
2130: 
2131: where $\hbar_{\text{eff}} = m\epsilon_c^2/\tau$ has dimension $[M][L]^2[T]^{-1}$ (action → energy when multiplied by inverse time).
2132: 
2133: **Step 4: Multi-particle sectors.**

hints.title: Discrete Spectrum
hints.content:
2139: :label: cor-discrete-spectrum-hamiltonian
2140: 
2141: The Hamiltonian $H$ has **discrete spectrum** in the low-energy regime:
2142: 
2143: $$
2144: \text{Spec}(H) = \{0, \Delta_H, 2\Delta_H, \ldots\} + \text{continuous spectrum}
2145: $$

2149: 
2150: :::{prf:proof}
2151: **Step 1: Fock space decomposition.**
2152: 
2153: $$
2154: \mathcal{H} = \bigoplus_{n=0}^\infty \mathcal{H}_n
2155: $$
2156: 
2157: Each $n$-particle sector has Hamiltonian:
2158: 
2159: $$
2160: H_n = \sum_{i=1}^n h_i + V_{\text{int}}
2161: $$
2162: 
2163: where $h_i$ is the single-particle Hamiltonian and $V_{\text{int}}$ are interactions.
2164: 
2165: **Step 2: Non-interacting case.**
2166: 
2167: For weak interactions, the spectrum is approximately:
2168: 
2169: $$
2170: E_n \approx n \Delta_H
2171: $$
2172: 
2173: giving discrete levels with gap $\Delta_H$.
2174: 
2175: **Step 3: Interaction corrections.**

hints.label: thm-mass-gap-continuum-survival
hints.title: Mass Gap Survival in Continuum Limit
hints.content:
2183: :label: thm-mass-gap-continuum-survival
2184: 
2185: The mass gap survives the continuum limit $\tau \to 0$ with the renormalization from {doc}`14_yang_mills_noether.md` §9.10:
2186: 
2187: $$
2188: \epsilon_c(\tau) \sim \sqrt{\tau}, \quad \rho(\tau) \sim \sqrt{\tau}, \quad \gamma(\tau) \sim \frac{1}{\tau}
2189: $$
2190: 
2191: The physical mass gap remains finite:
2192: 
2193: $$
2194: \Delta_{H, \text{phys}} = \lambda_{\text{gap}} \hbar_{\text{eff}} = \lambda_{\text{gap}} \frac{m\epsilon_c^2}{\tau} \sim \lambda_{\text{gap}} \frac{m\tau}{\tau} = \lambda_{\text{gap}} m = O(1)
hints.raw_directive:
